result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Corning Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CORRECTED FOR ADDITION OF 3 DAYS JAIL CREDIT.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
PERTAIN TO BOTH COUNTS: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Cases called: 15CM6 & 14CM279,  Defendant Brian K. Corning in court with attorney Margaret Andrea Waterman.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&3 in 15CM6 (Ct. 2 read in and dismissed). Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 years probation, conds. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. $443 & $243 costs. In 14CM279, Court  withheld sentence, placed defendant on probation for 2 years, $443 costs. No jail credit in 14CM279. Court granted 3 days jail credit in 15CM6. 15TR171 - no contest plea, judgment entered. $213.10 forfeiture, 60 days to pay.

Defendant Brian K. Corning in court with attorney Margaret Andrea Waterman.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. requesting new dates,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:50 pm.  Return date scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Alicia M. Nall appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New return date requested by Atty Nall.  Defendant wants a new atty.  Offer has been made by State.  Bond remains.  Public defenders office will be appointing a new atty.  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions w/letter re: discovery material filed by Atty Genda
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Nall

Defendant Brian K. Corning in court with attorney Alicia M. Nall.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nall just had the pretrial with ADA Genda.  Requesting a new return date.  Bond remains.  Return date scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
